required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real Time Ultrasound Guided Spinal Anesthesia in Elderly Patients: Paramedian Transverse Versus Parasagittal Oblique Approach
clinical_study.official_title: Real Time Ultrasound Guided Spinal Anesthesia in Elderly Patients: Paramedian Transverse Versus Parasagittal Oblique Approach

lead_sponsor.agency: American University of Beirut Medical Center

clinical_study.source: American University of Beirut Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: In this prospective randomized observational study, we aim to compare real time ultrasound-guided paramedian technique using parasagittal oblique view with real time ultrasound-guided paramedian technique using the paramedian transverse median view. Our aim is to find the most suitable real time ultrasound guided approach with regard to ease of performance defined as success rate at first attempt, number of puncture attempts, spinal procedure time, and patient satisfaction.

study_design_info.masking_description: Due to the nature of the study, blinding of the patients and anesthesiologist is not possible

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of successful Dural puncture on the first needle insertion attempt
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the begining of the procedure (during the needle insertion)
primary_outcome.description: Successful needle insertion on the first attempt

arm_group.arm_group_label: Real time ultrasound-guided Parasagittal oblique technique
Real time ultrasound-guided paramedian tranverse technique

intervention.description: the probe will be placed in a parasagittal plane to identify the articular processes then the sacrum will be identified. The probe will be moved cephalad in the parasagittal axis until the identification of the target lumbar interspaces L2-L3, L3-L4 or L4-L5. Once the appropriate lumbar interspace is identified, the probe will be tilted 45 degree towards the midline into a parasagittal oblique view. The needle will be inserted in plane from the caudal end of the ultrasound transducer with its tip directed towards the interlaminar space under real-time in-plane US guidance.
intervention.arm_group_label: Real time ultrasound-guided Parasagittal oblique technique

intervention.description: the transducer will be applied in the parasagittal plane, and after identification of the intervertebral level, the probe will be rotated 90 degrees into a transverse orientation and centered on the neuraxial midline in a way to align the beam with the interspinous and interlaminar space and thus to get a paramedian transverse interlaminar view. The needle will be inserted in plane from the lateral end of the ultrasound transducer with its tip directed towards the medial border of the articular process.
intervention.arm_group_label: Real time ultrasound-guided paramedian tranverse technique

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients aged more than 65 years
- American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status 1 to 3
- Can give informed consent
- scheduled for surgery amenable to spinal anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to give consent
- Patient refusal
- Contraindications to spinal anesthesia including coagulopathy
- INR>1.5
- Platelet count< 75 Ã— 109/L
- Indeterminate neurologic disease
- Local infection at the site of injection
- Allergy to local anesthetics
- Patients with back deformities (scoliosis, kyphosis, and with prior operations in the same area of the surgery)

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: American University of Beirut Medical Center
